components.description:
A chicken, a bird used for its meat and eggs. Generally depicted as the white head of a chicken (hen or rooster) looking left, with a yellow beak, red comb on its head, and red wattle on its neck.

May be consumed in the form of üçó Poultry Leg. Not to be confused with the full-bodied üêì Rooster, though their applications overlap. Also may be used for metaphorical senses of chicken (e.g., “coward”).

See also üê£ Hatching Chick, üê§ Baby Chick, and üê• Front-Facing Baby Chick.

Available as an Apple Animoji.

Twitter’s chicken head is looking straight ahead. Microsoft’s chicken was previously yellow, while Samsung’s faced forward; Facebook’s design once featured a full, brown bird, while Google’s design previously featured a full bodied chicken.
components.title: Chicken

title: Chicken

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A chicken with a yellow beak, red comb on top of the head, and red wattle (under the chin). Not to be mistaken with the rooster emoji. Somet http://emojipedia.org/chicken/
emoji_net_data.name: chicken

bn:00096625a: Impressed with fear or apprehension; in fear.
Impressed with fear or apprehension; in fear; apprehensive.

bn:00085015v: Make a clucking sounds, characteristic of hens

bn:00010605n: Warm-blooded egg-laying vertebrates characterized by feathers and forelimbs modified as wings
Birds are feathered, winged, two-legged, warm-blooded, egg-laying vertebrates.
Any of the bipedal, warm-blooded vertebrates that lay eggs having wings which, for most species, enables them to fly.
Feathered, winged, bipedal, endothermic, egg-laying, vertebrate animal
Birds are bipedal, warm-blooded, oviparous vertebrate animals characterized primarily by feathers, forelimbs modified as wings, and hollow bones.
A member of the class of animals Aves in the phylum Chordata, characterized by being warm-blooded, having feathers and wings usually capable of flight, and laying eggs.

bn:00020057n: The sound made by a hen, especially when brooding, or calling her chicks.
The sound made by a hen (as in calling her chicks)

bn:00018265n: Domesticated fowl, primarily a source of food
The flesh of a chicken used for food
The flesh of the domesticated chicken (Gallus gallus domesticus).
The chicken is a domesticated fowl, a subspecies of the Red Junglefowl.
Chickens are a domesticated fowl, a subspecies of the Red Junglefowl.
A hen; a cooked chicken; a chicken dressed for cooking.
A domestic fowl, Gallus gallus, especially when young
